May 1st, 1880. Catalogues of the students attending the early sessions have never before been published. James F. Harrison, Chairman.
BOARD OF VISITORS. JOSEPH C. CABELL, Rector. JOSEPH C. CABELL, CHAPMAN JOHNSON, JOHN H. COCKE, THOMAS JEFF. RANDOLPH. JAMES M. MASON. WM. C. RIVES, SAMUEL TAYLOR. Secretary of the Board, FRANK CARR.

FACULTY AND OFFICERS. JOHN A. G. DAVIS, Chairman of the Faculty. GESSNER HARRISON, Professor of Ancient Languages. GEO. W. BLÆTTERMANN, Professor of Modern Languages. CHARLES BONNYCASTLE, Professor of Mathematics. WM. B. ROGERS, Professor of Natural Philosophy. JOHN P. EMMET, Professor of Chemistry and Mat. Med. GEORGE TUCKER, Professor of Moral Philosophy. ALFRED T. MAGILL, Professor of Physiology, Medicine, Obstetrics and Medical Jurisprudence. JOHN A. G. DAVIS, Professor of Law AUGUSTUS L. WARNER, Demonstrator of Anatomy and Surgery. ALFRED T. MAGILL, Secretary of the Faculty. WM. WERTENBAKER, Librarian. W. G. PENDLETON, Proctor. ALEXANDER GARRETT, Bursar. REV. ROBERT RYLAND, Chaplain.

CATALOGUE OF STUDENTS. TWELFTH SESSION.—1835-1836. ABBREVIATIONS. A. L.—Ancient Languages M. L.—Modern Languages. M.—Mathematics. N. P.—Natural Philosophy. LAW.—Law. C.—Chemistry. M. P.—Moral Philosophy. MED.—Medicine. A. & S.—Anatomy & Surgery. NAMES. RESIDENCES. SCHOOLS ATTENDED. SES. Alston, Theodore South Carolina C, MED, A & S, M P, 2 Alston, Chas. J. P.
